title: Instant Pot Beef Bone Broth Recipe
description: For bone broth in the Instant Pot, save beef bones to make a rich broth with minimal preparation. Homemade bone broth has never been easier.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Broth and Stock Recipes Instant Pot Beef Bone Broth 4.8 (32) 26 Reviews 2 Photos Bone broth in the Instant Pot is easier than it seems. Don't toss those beef bones — freeze them, and when you have 2 pounds, follow this recipe to make your own with minimal prep! Submitted by Bren Updated on November 15, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 2 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 2 hrs 55 mins Additional Time: 10 mins Total Time: 3 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings cooking spray 2 pounds frozen beef bones 2 carrots, chopped 2 stalks celery, chopped 1 medium onion, quartered 5 cloves garlic, whole 6 cups boiling water 2 bay leaves 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar 1 teaspoon sea salt 10 whole black peppercorns Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place beef bones, carrots, celery, onion, and garlic on the prepared baking sheet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast in the preheated oven until browned, about 45 minutes. Scrape roasted bones and vegetables into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Add boiling water, bay leaves, vinegar, sea salt, and peppercorns. Close and lock the lid. Select Manual function according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 120 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove bones and vegetables and discard. Line a strainer with cheesecloth and set over a large bowl. Pour broth through the strainer and discard solids. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Allow broth to cool. Remove and discard the fat layer. Recipe Tip You can use bones from roasts and grilled steak, but do not use bones that have barbecue sauce on them. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 21 Calories 0g Fat 5g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 21 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 248mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 2g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 28mg 2% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 132mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Beef Bone Broth 01 of 02 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 02 Photo by  France C 02/03/2019 No need to use my slow cooker anymore for bone broth - using the IP is much quicker and easier! This is a great base recipe that can be customized to your preferences. I used marrow bones I bought from the butcher. I took them out of the oven at 30 mins as the vegetables were starting to burn, so maybe a slightly lower cook temp would be better. The broth didn't gel up like it normally does when I make it, but the flavor was still great! 1 You’ll Also Love Bone Broth 23 Ratings Instant Pot Chicken Noodle Soup 49 Ratings Instant Pot Vegetable Broth 3 Ratings Gluten-Free Vegan Stock for the Slow Cooker 3 Ratings Instant Pot Shrimp Broth 1 Rating Turkey Stock 18 Ratings Fish Sinigang (Tilapia) - Filipino Sour Broth Dish 31 Ratings Instant Pot Turkey Bone Broth World's Greatest Vegetable Broth 138 Ratings Instant Pot Mushroom Broth Instant Pot Turkey Stock Vegan and Gluten-Free Broth Powder 2 Ratings Rutabaga Stew 16 Ratings Tackee David's Split Pea with Ham 38 Ratings Butternut Squash Noodle Soup with Turkey 15 Ratings Roasted Garlic Potato Soup 69 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
